Award.AwardTitle: Workshop on Nanocontacts and Nanointerconnects; San Francisco, California; April 5, 2010

Division.LongName: Div Of Civil, Mechanical, & Manufact Inn

Award.AbstractNarration:
This grant provides funding to hold a Workshop on Nanocontacts and Nanointerconnects on April 5, 2010, in San Francisco, California, preceding the 2010 Material Research Society (MRS) Spring Meeting. The purpose of the workshop is to communicate the latest research on Nanocontacts and Nanointerconnects technology and to identify the key scientific and engineering challenges and opportunities to capitalize on nanostructures such as nanodots, nanowire, nanotubes and nanocables array integration.

This workshop will bring together several national labs, industries and university faculties in a format that allows the widest participation for graduate students and postdoctoral fellows, and would serve as a meeting to help and enhance faculties' and students' understanding of Nanocontacts and Nanointerconnects and will open opportunities for cooperative research between industries, national labs and universities. The workshop will provide excellent opportunities for students to find out what industry is interested and the industry participants get first-hand knowledge of the technology that are being pursued in the research community.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The first MRS Workshop on Nanocontacts and Nanointerconnects was held at the San Francisco Marriott on April 5, 2010. The purpose of the workshop was to communicate the latest research on Nanocontacts and Nanointerconnects technology and to identify the key scientific and engineering challenges and opportunities to capitalize on nanostructures (nanodots, nanowires, nanotubes and nanocables array integration). Our hope was that the workshopwould become a vehicle to foster collaborations between scientists and prospective industrial participants while promoting fundamental and interdisciplinary research.

In selecting the keynote and invited speakers for this one day workshop, we have made the utmost effort to bring together researchers from national labs, industries and universities who are on the forefront of nanocontacts and nanointerconnects technology in order to promote an interdisciplinary interaction. We have also included a venue for contributed papers in a format that we hope will provide the widest participation for graduate students and postdoctoral fellows. The workshop served as a meeting to help and enhance the students’ and the seasoned researchers’ understanding of Nanocontacts and Nanointerconnects and opened opportunities for cooperative research between industries, national labs and universities. MRS decided to include a regular symposium on Nanocontacts and Nanointerconnects in 2011 Spring Meeting.

 

Organizers:

 

Prof. M. Saif Islam, UC-Davis

A Alec Talin, NIST

King-Ning Tu, UCLA


Last Modified: 07/22/2011
Modified by: Sandra Devincent Wolf
